Posts.Content: First day back at work on Monday after being off since October with mastectomy and diep reconstruction. Not sure that I am looking forward to it or that I will be able to cope at first as it is a very busy "no rest for the wicked" office. Fingers crossed all will go well and I can get back into the swing of things and get my life back on track. PS Happy New Year to all xx
Posts.Title: First day back at work

Posts.Content: Thanks Allme I did think about a phased restart back but have just taken the Bull by the horns and am going back full time. I am sure I will be tired and will take your advice of a nap.  :-)
Posts.Title: First day back at work

Posts.Content: I had my check up 7 weeks ago and still no results letter but thankfully my bc nurse was good enough to give me the results over the phone when I called about something else.
Posts.Title: mammogram results?

Posts.Content: Hi Lucy I was in hospital for nearly 2  weeks after my op and reconstruction and after a couple of days was allowed showers but had to use baby wash and definitely no soap. Take a good book or ipad as can be boring in between visits although you will sleep a lot in the first couple of days.  Hope it all goes week for you.  T x
Posts.Title: Pre-op advice

Posts.Content: Hi There Holmlea Totally understand where you are coming from. I had a Diep Reconstruction on my left side 5 weeks ago and it feels like you are carrying a football under your arm. Things are starting the settle down now and it feels a lot more comfortable. Things get better every day/week and you will soon feel the difference.   Take Care and hope you feel better soon
Posts.Title: DIEP surgery

Posts.Content: HI Can anyone tell me if they are finding that they are getting more bruises than normal especially on your legs while taking tamoxifen.  I am sitting at the moment with 7 bruises on my legs and I only know where 1 came from. Been on tamoxifen for nearly 3 and a half years.  Thanks
Posts.Title: Bruising on tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Can anyone tell me if bone mets would show up on an xray. Have had a dodgy shoulder for months now and saw a consultant today who says he is 99.9% sure it's not but an mri  will make it 100% as they couldn't see anything on a xray. Thanks in advance for your input
Posts.Title: Bone mets

Posts.Content: Up for my 5 year check up this week and all was going good until :I have a patch of raised and red skin just at my mastectomy scar so consultant decided to take a punch biopsy so that he could get t￼heright cream to clear it up. Now I have to travel for 3 hours again next week for the results  Surely if this was for a cream they could just give me a prescription??? Brain working overtime now thiit could be something else
Posts.Title: Probably worrying over nothing

Posts.Content: Another check up over and done with and thankfully got the all clear :-) Happy Bunny. Hope you all have a lovely Sunday x
Posts.Title: 2 Year Check Up

Posts.Content: Going for my 2 year check up next week and nervous as usual although I am sure there will be nothing to worry about. Its amazing how things build up before appointments guess we will just have to get used to it. Hope you are all having a lovely Sundayxx
Posts.Title: 2 Year Check Up
